Research

Purude Univeristy - Video Analytics for Understanding Human Behavior

Lead Undergraduate Researcher

Led a team of 7 researchers on a multi-camera computer vision based human re-identification system sponsored by the NSF RAPID Grant, and developed a model to track humans within a 2-dimensional map to understand behavior patterns & trends.

The objective of the team was to develop a post-occupancy evaluation tool to understand human behavior in a given area and leverage the findings to effectively plan that space and boost productivity.

Automated Recording of Human Movement Using an Artificial Intelligence Identification and Mapping System

Interests

Apart from being a data analyst and student by profession, I enjoy spending time outdoors and being active. I like exercising, playing pickleball and soccer, and biking when I get the chance.

When forced indoors, I love watching movies & TV shows, and gaming on my PS5 - mostly FIFA and Call of Duty. I like to cook and play board games with my friends, and am trying to get better at chess!

I actively follow sports too - my teams are Manchester City in the EPL, Ferrari in Formula One, and Purdue in College Basketball (Boiler Up!). I'm also a guitarist (have been playing for 15 years!) and have an acoustic guitar with me in Chicago.
